results.title: Group training
results.creator_credit: Victori Menzies, Peter Bradford and World Wide Pictures
results.brief_description: The advantags of small and medium sized companies pooling their resources to provide for the training of apprentices. The actual course shown is concerned with apprentice training in the engineering industry.

results.title: Group Teaching -the Use of a Theme
results.brief_description: To stimulate discussion about group tuition. This film shows one group and a staff tutor plus a volunteer tutor choosing a theme and all the activities it leads to with training a particular group.

results.title: Group productivity (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Ron Underwood, Janice M Reynolds and CRM Productions
results.brief_description: Divides group development into three phases: Orientation, Power Distribution and Tasking, Team Production and Feedback. Demonstrates the delicate balance between tasking and nurturing for each phase and gives examples of coping and motivational strategies useful in daily living.

results.title: Groundwork for progress
results.creator_credit: Bill Mason, Stewart McAllister and British Transport Films
results.brief_description: Today Britain is bringing her century-old railway system up to date. The modernisation plan includes relaying lines, strengthening bridges, and viaducts, and building new stations, good sheds, sidings, and marshalling yards. Shows the engineering problems are tackled and the work carried out without dislocation traffic on the most heavily used railway system in the world.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bill Mason, Stewart McAllister and British Transport Films

results.title: Groundwater
results.creator_credit: Bert Van Bork and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Explains the origins of groundwater and the relation of groundwater to the water cycle. Emphasizes the need for conservation and protection of the water supply from chemical and nuclear waste.

results.title: Ground water
results.brief_description: A study of ground water; the following aspects are dealt with in detail: the funtion of water in changing the face of the earth in producing spectacular geological phenomena, and its vital importance to man; artesian systems, springs, wells, water tables, caves; such spectacular phenomena as geysers, roaring springs, hot springs, sink holes, petrification, geode fillings, and the concentration of minerals. Below the surface of the earth, often unknown to man, water works many transformations. Both animation and direct photography of well-known examples of these various phenomena, many of them famous as tourist attractions in USA are presented in this film.

results.title: Grott
results.creator_credit: Neil Robinson and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: An auto-aesthetic analysis of the conceptual indeterminacy of the slides-of-our-holiday genre, probing the Milesian paranomasia inherent in the aetiology of the medium, specifically, (a)where are we going? (b)what does it all mean? (c)who are all these people?

constellations_other.name: Screen story searching
constellations_other.description: Cinema, smartphones and sensuality collide in this intriguing Constellation that takes a distinctly different path.

results.title: Groove squad [DVD]
results.brief_description: In this animated feature, three exuberant teenage friends, Chrissie, Ping and Mac, are ambitious cheerleaders and students at Bay City High School. After a freak accident, and much to their delight, they are transformed into super-heroes obtaining the skills, respectively, of extraordinary strength, X-ray vision and flying. Joining the dynamic trio in their quest to combat the evil-doings of various villains is Adrian, their funky hairdresser and Zeke, a boy who nurses a serious crush on Ping. The girls however don’t neglect their cheerleading duties but continue to practise their rigorous routines in readiness for the Bay City cheerleading championships. As head cheerleader, Chrissie is frequently in conflict with her colleague, Star, a wealthy girl who covets Chrissie’s status. As the Groove squad learn to comprehend the extent of their powers (which come and go, not always at their behest) they learn the value of working as a team in the spirit of friendship. This film, suitable for children and pitched at teens and pre-teens, has an endearing comic tone that supports the neo-feminist values of ‘girl power’.
